email_response module¶

class email_response.Response(pusher: tuple, branch: str)[source]¶

Bases: object

__init__(pusher: tuple, branch: str)[source]¶

Initialize a new email response object.

Parameters:

  • pusher (tuple) – A tuple containing (name, email) of the person who pushed the changes

  • branch (str) – The name of the branch where changes were pushed

response¶

The email message object

Type:

MIMEMultipart

timestamp¶

Current timestamp in ‘YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS’ format

Type:

str

NAME_RECEIVER¶

Name of the person who pushed the changes

Type:

str

EMAIL_RECEIVER¶

Email of the person who pushed the changes

Type:

str

EMAIL_SENDER¶

Email address used to send notifications

Type:

str

EMAIL_PASSWORD¶

Password for the sender email (from environment variables)

Type:

str

EMAIL_SUBJECT¶

Subject line of the email

Type:

str

SMTP_SERVER¶

SMTP server address

Type:

str

SMTP_PORT¶

SMTP server port number

Type:

int

body¶

List of strings containing the email body content

Type:

list

Example

>>> pusher = ("John Doe", "john@example.com")
>>> email_response = Response(pusher, "main")
>>> email_response.append_content("Tests passed successfully")
>>> email_response.make_response()
>>> email_response.send_response()
append_content(info)[source]¶

Append new content to the email body.

Parameters:

info – The information to be added to the email body

make_response()[source]¶

Construct the email message with headers and body.

Combines all the content in self.body into a single email message, adds headers (From, To, Subject), and attaches the body text.

Example

>>> email_response.append_content("Build successful")
>>> email_response.make_response()  # Prepares email for sending
send_response()[source]¶

Send the email using SMTP with TLS.

Establishes a connection to the SMTP server, authenticates using the provided credentials, sends the email, and closes the connection.

Raises:

Exception – If there is an error during the email sending process

Example

>>> try:
...     email_response.send_response()
... except Exception as e:
...     print(f"Failed to send email: {e}")
